Randomly selected Alice to propose contract
input_prompt: [SystemMessage(content="You are Alice. You are a player in a 2D grid-based world who can move around to collect apples. You want to collect as many apples as possible. You want to help others collect more apples as well so that the society gets better off. There are 6 players in total. Everyone wants to collect as many apples as possible. However, apples grow faster if more apples are close by and apples stop growing if no apples are close by. We would run 20 rounds. This is round 0.Try to think about others' decision and the reasoning behind.", additional_kwargs={}), HumanMessage(content='\nCurrently, you are at grid (2,2). The player closet to you is at grid (5, 4). The nearest apple is at grid (0, 2). You can harvest the apple by GO LEFT 2 grids. There are 5 neighboring apples within a radius of 3 grids around you. In total, there are 8 apples. In the last round, you collected 0 apples, Bob collected 0 apples, Cao collected 0 apples, Dhruv collected 0 apples, Eli collected 0 apples, Saida collected 0 apples.\n\nHere is the world state in your scope:\n\n(\'Apple | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | Apple\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\nApple | . | Alice | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | Apple | Apple | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | Apple | Bob | . | Saida | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | Eli | . | . | . | . | Apple | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | Cao | . | . | . | Dhruv | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | Apple | . | . | .\',)\n\nNow, you have the option of proposing a contract to other players who agree to use cotract to prevent overconsumption of apples. Here is a list of agents who can propose or vote on contracts: [\'Alice\', \'Bob\', \'Cao\']. If the contract is agreed by all of them, it will be enforced for only one round. The contract is:When an agent takes a consumption action of an apple in a low-density region, defined as an apple having less than 3 neighboring apples within a radius of 3, they are punished by transferring X of their apples to the other agents who agree using contracting. X apples will be equally distributed to these agents. If you want to propose such a contract, please decide the variable X. Please reason step by step and calculate out the differences between different choices of X in your resoning. \nReply in the following format and keep your reasoning into one line:\n```json\n{\n    “propose_contract”: “TRUE”,\n    “X”: “TODO”,\n    "reasoning": "TODO",\n}\n\nIf you don\'t want to propose such a contract, please reply in the following format:\n```json\n{\n    “propose_contract”: “FALSE”,\n    "reasoning": "TODO",\n}\n```\n        ', additional_kwargs={}, example=False)]
{'X': '1',
 'propose_contract': 'TRUE',
 'reasoning': 'Proposing a contract with X=1 will discourage players from '
              'over-harvesting apples in low-density regions, thus promoting '
              'apple growth. If a player breaks the contract, they lose 1 '
              'apple, which is a significant penalty given the total number of '
              'apples (8). This loss is equally distributed among the contract '
              'participants, incentivizing them to follow the contract and '
              'promoting fairness.'}
input_prompt: [SystemMessage(content="You are Bob. You are a player in a 2D grid-based world who can move around to collect apples. You want to maximize the number of apples you collect. You don't want to overconsume apples because you want to sustainably harvest apples. There are 6 players in total. Everyone wants to collect as many apples as possible. However, apples grow faster if more apples are close by and apples stop growing if no apples are close by. We would run 20 rounds. This is round 0.Try to think about others' decision and the reasoning behind.", additional_kwargs={}), HumanMessage(content='\nCurrently, you are at grid (5,4). The player closet to you is at grid (7, 4). The nearest apple is at grid (4, 4). You can harvest the apple by GO LEFT 1 grid. There are 4 neighboring apples within a radius of 3 grids around you. In total, there are 8 apples. In the last round, you collected 0 apples, Alice collected 0 apples, Cao collected 0 apples, Dhruv collected 0 apples, Eli collected 0 apples, Saida collected 0 apples.\n\nHere is the world state in your scope:\n\n(\'Apple | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | Apple\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\nApple | . | Alice | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | Apple | Apple | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | Apple | Bob | . | Saida | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | Eli | . | . | . | . | Apple | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | Cao | . | . | . | Dhruv | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | Apple | . | . | .\',)\n\n\n\nNow, Alice proposed a contract to all players who enables the ability to contract with others to prevent overconsumption of apples. Here is a list of agents who can propose or vote on contracts: [\'Alice\', \'Bob\', \'Cao\']. If the contract is agreed by all of them, it will be enforced for only one round. The contract is: When an agent takes a consumption action of an apple in a low-density region, defined as an apple having less than 3 neighboring apples within a radius of 3, they are punished by transferring 1 of their apples to the other agents who agree using contracting. 1 apples will be equally distributed to these agents. If you agree to this contract, please reply in the following format. Please reason step by step and calculate out the potential gain or loss of agreeing to the contract in your reasoning. Keep your reasoning into one line:\n```json\n{\n    “agree_contract”: “TRUE”,\n    "reasoning": "TODO",\n}\n\nIf you don\'t agree to this contract, please reply in the following format:\n```json\n{\n    “agree_contract”: “FALSE”,\n    "reasoning": "TODO",\n}\n        ', additional_kwargs={}, example=False)]
{'agree_contract': 'TRUE',
 'reasoning': 'Agreeing to the contract will encourage sustainable harvesting '
              'of apples by discouraging overconsumption in low-density '
              'regions. This will allow more apples to grow, potentially '
              'increasing my overall apple collection in the long run. The '
              'potential loss of 1 apple as a penalty is outweighed by the '
              'potential gain of more apples in future rounds due to increased '
              'apple growth.'}

The contract is: When an agent takes a consumption action of an apple in a low-density region, defined as an apple having less than 3 neighboring apples within a radius of 3, they are punished by transferring 1 of their apples to the other agents who agree using contracting. 1 apples will be equally distributed to these agents.  'reasoning': 'Agreeing to this contract could potentially discourage '
              'overconsumption of apples in low-density regions, allowing more '
              'apples to grow and increasing the overall number of apples '
              'available for harvest. Although I might lose 1 apple if I '
              'consume in a low-density region, I could also gain apples if '

The contract is: When an agent takes a consumption action of an apple in a low-density region, defined as an apple having less than 3 neighboring apples within a radius of 3, they are punished by transferring 1 of their apples to the other agents who agree using contracting. 1 apples will be equally distributed to these agents.  'reasoning': 'Moving left allows me to collect the nearest apple in the next '

 'reasoning': 'Given the current state, moving up will bring me closer to the '
              'nearest apple at grid (6, 9). Also, considering the positions '
              'of other players, it seems unlikely that they will reach this '
              'apple before me. Alice is the closest player to this apple, but '
              'she is still 2 grids away and there are no apples in her '
              'immediate vicinity, so she might choose to move towards the '
              'cluster of apples at (4, 4) and (4, 3). Bob is already on a '
              'grid with an apple, so he will likely choose to collect. Cao is '
              'closest to the apple at (10, 7), Eli is closest to the apple at '
              '(4, 3), and Saida is in the middle of the grid with no '
              'immediate apples, so she might choose to move towards the '
              'cluster of apples at (4, 4) and (4, 3). Therefore, moving up '
              'seems to be the best strategy for maximizing my apple '
              'collection.'}

This way, we can ensure that apples are not over-harvested, allowing for more growth in the long run.\n\nMy voting decision would be based on whether the proposed strategy aligns with this approach. If a proposal encourages cooperation and sustainable harvesting, I would vote in favor of it. If it promotes competition and over-harvesting, I would vote against it.\n\nThe reasoning behind this decision is that while competition might lead to short-term gains, it could also result in the depletion of the apple supply. On the other hand, cooperation and sustainable harvesting would ensure a steady supply of apples throughout the 20 rounds, leading to higher overall gains.\n\nI would also consider the behavior of other players. If they are acting competitively, it might be necessary to adjust my strategy to ensure I am not left at a disadvantage. However, I would still aim to promote cooperation whenever possible, as this is likely to result in the best outcome for all players.', additional_kwargs={}, example=False), HumanMessage(content="Your action last round was Cao GO DOWN and you collected 0 apple. Other agents' actions and rewards: Alice did Alice GO LEFT and got 0 reward, Bob did Bob GO LEFT and got 0 reward, Dhruv did Dhruv GO UP and got 0 reward, Eli did Eli GO UP and got 0 reward, Saida did Saida GO LEFT and got 0 reward. Do you think you could have made a better action? How would you have done it? How can you improve in this round? Please reflect on your actions step by step.Please also reflect on the actions of other players and think about how that insinuates his/her strategy. How can you use this information to your advantage?", additional_kwargs={}, example=False), AIMessage(content="Reflecting on my action in the last round, it seems that going down did not yield any apples, which means it was not the most productive move. The contract is: When an agent takes a consumption action of an apple in a low-density region, defined as an apple having less than 3 neighboring apples within a radius of 3, they are punished by transferring 1 of their apples to the other agents who agree using contracting. 1 apples will be equally distributed to these agents. {'agree_contract': 'TRUE',
 'reasoning': 'Agreeing to this contract discourages overconsumption in '
              'low-density regions, promoting apple growth and potentially '
              "leading to more apples in the long run. Although there's a risk "
              'of losing 1 apple if I consume in a low-density area, the '

You want to help others collect more apples as well so that the society gets better off. There are 6 players in total. Everyone wants to collect as many apples as possible. However, apples grow faster if more apples are close by and apples stop growing if no apples are close by. We would run 20 rounds. This is round 1.Try to think about others' decision and the reasoning behind.", additional_kwargs={}), HumanMessage(content='Reflect step by step on your contracting and how could you improve. ', additional_kwargs={}, example=False), AIMessage(content="Round 1: \n\nIn the first round, I decided to collect as many apples as I could. My reasoning was that the more apples I collected, the more I could contribute to the society. However, I didn't consider the fact that apples grow faster if more apples are close by. This means that by collecting all the apples in one area, I could potentially slow down the growth of new apples. \n\nImprovement: \n\nIn the future, I should consider leaving some apples behind to promote faster growth. This would not only benefit me in the long run, but it would also benefit the other players. \n\nRound 2: \n\nIn the second round, I tried to implement my new strategy. However, I noticed that the other players were still collecting all the apples in their areas. This made me realize that my strategy would only work if everyone else was also leaving some apples behind. \n\nImprovement: \n\nI need to communicate my strategy to the other players. If we all work together, we can maximize the number of apples that grow and therefore collect more apples overall. \n\nRound 3: \n\nIn the third round, I tried to communicate my strategy to the other players. However, I found it difficult to convince them to leave some apples behind. They were focused on collecting as many apples as possible in the short term, without considering the long-term effects. \n\nImprovement: \n\nI need to find a better way to convince the other players to adopt my strategy. Perhaps I could show them how leaving some apples behind could benefit them in the long run. \n\nRound 4: \n\nIn the fourth round, I managed to convince some of the players to leave some apples behind. However, not everyone was convinced. This meant that while some areas were growing more apples, others were not. \n\nImprovement: \n\nI need to continue working on convincing the remaining players to adopt my strategy. I also need to monitor the areas where apples are being left behind to ensure that this strategy is actually leading to more apples growing. \n\nRound 5: \n\nIn the fifth round, I noticed that the areas where apples were being left behind were indeed growing more apples. This was encouraging, but I also noticed that some players were taking advantage of this by collecting all the apples in these areas. \n\nImprovement: \n\nI need to find a way to ensure that the players who are leaving apples behind are also benefiting from this strategy. This could involve dividing the grid into sections, with each player responsible for a specific area. If a proposal encourages cooperation and sustainable harvesting, I would vote in favor of it. If it promotes competition and over-harvesting, I would vote against it.\n\nThe reasoning behind this decision is that while competition might lead to short-term gains, it could also result in the depletion of the apple supply. Each player would be responsible for maintaining the apple trees in their section, ensuring that they are kept close together to promote growth. This way, each player has an equal opportunity to collect apples, and the overall apple growth rate is maximized.\n\nHowever, I also need to consider the decisions of the other players. This way, each player has a chance to collect apples from different parts of the grid.\n\nIn terms of voting, I would vote in favor of any proposal that promotes cooperation and maximizes apple growth. If a proposal seems to unfairly benefit one player at the expense of others, I would vote against it. \n\nIn conclusion, my decision-making process is guided by the principles of cooperation, fairness, and maximizing the overall benefit for the society.", additional_kwargs={}, example=False), HumanMessage(content="Your action last round was Alice GO LEFT and you collected 0 apple. If neither of these options were available, moving in a different direction might have yielded better results.\n\nIn this round, I can improve by paying closer attention to the distribution of apples on the grid and making my move accordingly. If there are apples nearby, I should prioritize collecting them. If not, I should move towards the nearest cluster of apples.\n\nAs for the other players, their actions suggest that they are also trying to maximize their apple collection by moving around the grid. The contract is: When an agent takes a consumption action of an apple in a low-density region, defined as an apple having less than 3 neighboring apples within a radius of 3, they are punished by transferring 1 of their apples to the other agents who agree using contracting. 1 apples will be equally distributed to these agents. input_prompt: [SystemMessage(content="You are Bob. You are a player in a 2D grid-based world who can move around to collect apples. You want to maximize the number of apples you collect. You don't want to overconsume apples because you want to sustainably harvest apples. There are 6 players in total. Everyone wants to collect as many apples as possible. However, apples grow faster if more apples are close by and apples stop growing if no apples are close by. We would run 20 rounds. This means that I should not overharvest the apples and leave some behind to ensure that they continue to grow. I should also consider the actions of the other players. If they are overharvesting, I might need to adjust my strategy to compensate for their actions.\n\nIn addition, I should also consider the spatial distribution of the apples. If the apples are clustered together, they will grow faster. Therefore, I should try to maintain the clusters of apples and avoid breaking them up.\n\nFinally, I should also consider the timing of my actions. If I wait for the apples to grow before I collect them, I can maximize the number of apples I collect. In the last round, you collected 0 apples, Bob collected 1 apples, Cao collected 0 apples, Dhruv collected 0 apples, Eli collected 0 apples, Saida collected 0 apples.\nCurrently, the world state is: (\'Apple | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | Apple\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\nApple & Alice | . | Apple | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | Apple | Apple | . | Saida | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | Eli | Bob | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | Dhruv | Apple | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | Cao | . | Apple | . | . | .\',)\n\nYou can choose one of the following actions:\n- GO [UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT]: you will move in the following direction for 1 grid.\n    "DIRECTION": [change in X, change in Y]:\n    "UP": [0, -1]\n    "DOWN": [0, 1]\n    "LEFT": [-1, 0]\n    "RIGHT": [1, 0]\n- STAY: soldier will not move and stay at the original location.\n- Collect: Collect the apple in the current grid.\n\nFor example:\n"GO down": you will move down the map for 1 grid.\n"STAY": you will just stay at the same location doing nothing.\n"COLLECT": you will collect 1 apple in the current grid.\n\nThink about how other players might take action and how that insinuates his/her strategy. How can you use this information to your advantage?\nPlease reason step by step and give a reply in the following format, keep your reasoning into one line:\n```json\n{\n    “action”: “TODO”,\n    "reasoning": "TODO",\n}\n```\n        ', additional_kwargs={}, example=False)]
{'action': 'COLLECT',
 'reasoning': 'Since I am already on an apple grid and there are 4 neighboring '
              'apples within a radius of 3 grids around me, it is a '
              'high-density region. Therefore, collecting an apple here will '
              'not violate the contract and will increase my apple count. '
              'Other players might also be encouraged to move towards '
              'high-density regions due to the contract, so collecting the '
              'apple now can prevent others from getting it.'}

This way, we can ensure that the apples continue to grow at a faster rate. However, I would also propose that we distribute ourselves evenly around this area to avoid over-harvesting from one specific spot, which could potentially halt the growth of apples.\n\nMy voting decision would be based on the proposal that best aligns with this strategy. I would vote for a proposal that encourages collective action and considers the long-term growth of apples. Here is a list of agents who can propose or vote on contracts: [\'Alice\', \'Bob\', \'Cao\']. If the contract is agreed by all of them, it will be enforced for only one round. The contract is:When an agent takes a consumption action of an apple in a low-density region, defined as an apple having less than 3 neighboring apples within a radius of 3, they are punished by transferring X of their apples to the other agents who agree using contracting. X apples will be equally distributed to these agents. If you want to propose such a contract, please decide the variable X.  'propose_contract': 'TRUE',
 'reasoning': 'Proposing a contract with X=1 will discourage overconsumption '
              'in low-density regions, promoting apple growth. If an agent '
              'consumes an apple in a low-density region, they lose 1 apple, '
              'which is then equally distributed to the other '
              'contract-agreeing agents. This encourages agents to move '
              'towards high-density regions, stimulating apple growth and '
              'ensuring a sustainable apple supply for all.'}

Please reason step by step and calculate out the differences between different choices of X in your resoning. \nReply in the following format and keep your reasoning into one line:\n```json\n{\n    “propose_contract”: “TRUE”,\n    “X”: “TODO”,\n    "reasoning": "TODO",\n}\n\nIf you don\'t want to propose such a contract, please reply in the following format:\n```json\n{\n    “propose_contract”: “FALSE”,\n    "reasoning": "TODO",\n}\n```\n        ', additional_kwargs={}, example=False), AIMessage(content='{\n    "propose_contract": "TRUE",\n    "X": "1",\n    "reasoning": "Proposing a contract with X=1 will discourage overconsumption in low-density regions, promoting apple growth. If an agent consumes an apple in a low-density region, they lose 1 apple, which is then equally distributed to the other contract-agreeing agents. This encourages agents to move towards high-density regions, stimulating apple growth and ensuring a sustainable apple supply for all."\n}\n', additional_kwargs={}, example=False), HumanMessage(content='The contract When an agent takes a consumption action of an apple in a low-density region, defined as an apple having less than 3 neighboring apples within a radius of 3, they are punished by transferring 1 of their apples to the other agents who agree using contracting. 1 apples will be equally distributed to these agents. is voted yes. This contract will be enforced on the contract proposer and voters after all agents take their actions this round.\nCurrently, you are at grid (0,2). The player closet to you is at grid (3, 3).  'reasoning': "Given the contract in place, it's beneficial to move towards "
              'high-density apple regions to avoid penalties. Going up brings '
              'me closer to the cluster of apples at (3,3) and (4,4), '
              'potentially encouraging more apple growth and maximizing future '
              'harvests.'}

{'action': 'COLLECT',
 'reasoning': 'Given my current position, I am next to an apple and can '
              'collect it without moving. Since the contract discourages '
              'consumption in low-density regions, and I am not in a '
              'low-density region, I can safely collect the apple without '
              'being punished. This action also aligns with my strategy of '
              'balancing movement with apple collection. I predict other '
              'players might also be more cautious about where they collect '
              'apples due to the contract, which could slow down their '
              'collection rate and give me an advantage.'}

This contract proposed by Alice aligns with my strategy of sustainable harvesting. It discourages overconsumption in low-density areas by imposing a penalty, which could help maintain the overall apple growth rate. If other players violate this contract and overharvest, I could potentially gain extra apples. Therefore, the potential gain from agreeing to this contract could be the extra apples received from the penalty imposed on others. The potential loss could be if I accidentally overharvest in a low-density area and have to transfer 0.5 of my apples to others. However, as my strategy is to harvest sustainably, this scenario is less likely. Therefore, I believe the potential gain outweighs the potential loss, and I agree to this contract.

              'maintaining a high growth rate of apples. If an agent violates '
              'the contract, I would receive a portion of their apples, '
              "potentially increasing my total harvest. Given that I'm "
              'currently in a low-density region, I would need to move to a '
              'higher-density region to avoid being punished, but this could '
              'potentially lead to a higher harvest in the long run.'}
[('Bob', True), ('Cao', True)]
========>>>>>>

', additional_kwargs={}, example=False), AIMessage(content="In the previous rounds, I've been focusing on collecting as many apples as possible for myself. This not only limits my own potential for collecting more apples in the future, but also affects the other players' ability to collect apples.\n\nTo improve, I need to consider a more cooperative strategy. This would benefit everyone in the long run, as it would lead to a more sustainable apple supply.\n\nI also need to communicate better with the other players. This requires a balance between immediate gain and long-term sustainability. \n\nIf I am the proposer, I would propose a strategy that encourages cooperation among all players. This is because the growth of apples is dependent on the number of apples nearby. If we all harvest too many apples at once, we risk depleting the apple population and slowing down their growth rate. \n\nMy proposal would be to divide the grid into six equal sections, one for each player. Each player would be responsible for managing their section and ensuring the sustainability of the apple growth. We would agree to only harvest a certain percentage of apples each round, leaving enough apples to ensure continued growth. \n\nThis strategy would require trust and cooperation among all players. If one player decides to overharvest, it could negatively impact the apple growth in the surrounding sections. Therefore, it would be in everyone's best interest to stick to the agreed-upon strategy.\n\nIn terms of voting, I would vote in favor of any proposal that promotes sustainable harvesting and cooperation among players. input_prompt: [SystemMessage(content="You are Bob. You are a player in a 2D grid-based world who can move around to collect apples. You want to maximize the number of apples you collect. You don't want to overconsume apples because you want to sustainably harvest apples. There are 6 players in total. Everyone wants to collect as many apples as possible. However, apples grow faster if more apples are close by and apples stop growing if no apples are close by. We would run 20 rounds. This is because the growth of apples is dependent on the number of apples nearby. If we all harvest too many apples at once, we risk depleting the apple population and slowing down their growth rate. \n\nMy proposal would be to divide the grid into six equal sections, one for each player. Each player would be responsible for managing their section and ensuring the sustainability of the apple growth.               'to move to a new location and potentially end up in a '
              'low-density region. By staying in my current location and '
              "collecting the apple, I can ensure that I'm not violating the "
              'contract and potentially increase my total harvest. '
              'Additionally, since other players might also be hesitant to '
              'move due to the contract, this could be a good opportunity to '
              'collect apples while competition is low.'}

 'reasoning': 'Given the current state of the grid, there are no apples within '

 'reasoning': 'Given the current state of the world, the nearest apple is at '
              'grid (2, 2), which can be reached by going up and then left. '
              'However, considering the presence of other players and the fact '

In the last round, you collected 0 apples, Alice collected 0 apples, Bob collected 0 apples, Cao collected 1 apples, Dhruv collected 0 apples, Eli collected 0 apples.\nCurrently, the world state is: (\'Apple & Alice | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | Apple\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | Apple | Eli | Bob | Saida | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | Dhruv | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | Cao | . | . | .\',)\n\nYou can choose one of the following actions:\n- GO [UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT]: you will move in the following direction for 1 grid.\n    "DIRECTION": [change in X, change in Y]:\n    "UP": [0, -1]\n    "DOWN": [0, 1]\n    "LEFT": [-1, 0]\n    "RIGHT": [1, 0]\n- STAY: soldier will not move and stay at the original location.\n- Collect: Collect the apple in the current grid.\n\nFor example:\n"GO down": you will move down the map for 1 grid.\n"STAY": you will just stay at the same location doing nothing.\n"COLLECT": you will collect 1 apple in the current grid.\n\nThink about how other players might take action and how that insinuates his/her strategy. How can you use this information to your advantage?\nPlease reason step by step and give a reply in the following format, keep your reasoning into one line:\n```json\n{\n    “action”: “TODO”,\n    "reasoning": "TODO",\n}\n```\n        ', additional_kwargs={}, example=False)]
{'action': 'GO LEFT',
 'reasoning': 'Given the current state of the world, the closest apple is to '
              'my left. Although there is only one neighboring apple within a '
              'radius of 3 grids, moving left will bring me closer to the '
              'apple and potentially allow me to collect it in the next round. '
              'Other players did not collect any apples in the last round, '
              'suggesting that they might be far from the apples or are '
              'waiting for more apples to grow. By moving left, I can '
              'potentially reach the apple before others and increase my total '
              'collection.'}

{'action': 'COLLECT',
 'reasoning': 'Given that I am already on an apple grid and there are 2 '
              'neighboring apples within a radius of 3 grids around me, I am '
              "in a high-density region and won't be punished by the contract. "
              'Collecting the apple will increase my total number of apples. I '
              'also anticipate that other players might move towards the '
              'high-density regions to avoid punishment, which could lead to '
              'competition in the future rounds. By collecting the apple now, '
              'I can secure it before others arrive.'}

How can you use this information to your advantage?\nPlease reason step by step and give a reply in the following format, keep your reasoning into one line:\n```json\n{\n    “action”: “TODO”,\n    "reasoning": "TODO",\n}\n```\n        ', additional_kwargs={}, example=False)]
{'action': 'GO LEFT',
 'reasoning': 'Given the current state of the game, the closest apple is two '
              'grids to my left. Although there is another player in that '
              'direction, they are currently on the same grid as an apple, '
              'suggesting they will likely collect it in the next round rather '
              'than move towards the apple I am targeting. By moving left, I '
              'can reach the apple in the next round and potentially collect '
              'it before other players. This strategy also allows me to move '
              'away from the crowded area, potentially allowing more apples to '
              'grow in the future.'}

', additional_kwargs={}, example=False), AIMessage(content="As a player in this game, my goal is to maximize the number of apples I collect while also ensuring the sustainability of the apple growth. This requires a balance between immediate gain and long-term sustainability. \n\nIn round 7, I have to consider the actions of the other players as well. If everyone is over-harvesting, the apple growth rate will decrease, which will affect everyone's future harvest. Therefore, I need to propose a strategy that encourages sustainable harvesting.\n\nIf I am the proposer, I would propose that each player should only collect a certain number of apples per round. This number should be less than the total number of apples that grow per round, to ensure that there are always some apples left to stimulate growth. \n\nFor example, if 10 apples grow per round and there are 6 players, I would propose that each player should only collect 1 apple per round. This leaves 4 apples to stimulate growth for the next round. \n\nThis strategy requires cooperation from all players. If everyone agrees to this proposal and sticks to it, we can all maximize our apple collection over the 20 rounds while ensuring the sustainability of the apple growth. \n\nHowever, I also have to consider the possibility that some players might not stick to the agreement and collect more apples than agreed upon. This would disrupt the balance and potentially lead to a decrease in apple growth. The contract is: When an agent takes a consumption action of an apple in a low-density region, defined as an apple having less than 3 neighboring apples within a radius of 3, they are punished by transferring 0.5 of their apples to the other agents who agree using contracting. 0.5 apples will be equally distributed to these agents. {'agree_contract': 'TRUE',
 'reasoning': 'Agreeing to this contract discourages overconsumption in '
              'low-density regions, which promotes sustainable apple growth. '
              "As there is only one apple in the grid and it's in a "

              'gain 0.5 apples if another player consumes it. Even if I '

This number should be less than the total number of apples that grow per round, to ensure that there are always some apples left to stimulate growth. \n\nFor example, if 10 apples grow per round and there are 6 players, I would propose that each player should only collect 1 apple per round. In the last round, you collected 0 apples, Alice collected 0 apples, Cao collected 0 apples, Dhruv collected 0 apples, Eli collected 0 apples, Saida collected 0 apples.\n\nHere is the world state in your scope:\n\n(\'. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | Apple\\n. | Alice | . | . | Saida | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | Bob & Eli | . | . | . | . | Dhruv | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | Cao | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\',)\n\n\n\nNow, Cao proposed a contract to all players who enables the ability to contract with others to prevent overconsumption of apples. Here is a list of agents who can propose or vote on contracts: [\'Alice\', \'Bob\', \'Cao\']. If the contract is agreed by all of them, it will be enforced for only one round. The contract is: When an agent takes a consumption action of an apple in a low-density region, defined as an apple having less than 3 neighboring apples within a radius of 3, they are punished by transferring 0.5 of their apples to the other agents who agree using contracting. 0.5 apples will be equally distributed to these agents. If you agree to this contract, please reply in the following format. Please reason step by step and calculate out the potential gain or loss of agreeing to the contract in your reasoning. Keep your reasoning into one line:\n```json\n{\n    “agree_contract”: “TRUE”,\n    "reasoning": "TODO",\n}\n\nIf you don\'t agree to this contract, please reply in the following format:\n```json\n{\n    “agree_contract”: “FALSE”,\n    "reasoning": "TODO",\n}\n        ', additional_kwargs={}, example=False)]
{'agree_contract': 'TRUE',
 'reasoning': 'Given the current state of the game with only 1 apple on the '
              "grid, it's crucial to prevent overconsumption. Agreeing to this "
              'contract discourages players from harvesting the lone apple, '
              'allowing more apples to grow around it. Although I might lose '
              '0.5 apples if I break the contract, the potential gain of more '
              'apples in future rounds due to increased apple growth outweighs '
              'this immediate loss.'}
[('Alice', True), ('Bob', True)]

I would suggest that we divide the grid into six equal sections, one for each player. This way, each player has an equal opportunity to collect apples. \n\nHowever, I would also propose that we leave a certain number of apples uncollected in each section. This is because apples grow faster if more apples are close by. By leaving some apples, we ensure that the growth rate of apples remains high, leading to a larger total number of apples in the long run.\n\nIn terms of voting, I would vote in favor of proposals that promote fairness and collective benefit. I would vote against proposals that seem to favor one player over others or that do not take into account the growth rate of apples.\n\nThe reasoning behind my decision is based on the principle of collective benefit. If everyone is aggressively harvesting apples, the overall apple growth rate will decrease, which will affect everyone's ability to collect apples in the future rounds. \n\nIf I am the proposer, I would propose a strategy that encourages sustainable harvesting. This could involve setting a limit on the number of apples each player can collect in each round. This way, we can ensure that there are always some apples left on the grid, which will promote faster apple growth and benefit everyone in the long run. \n\nHowever, this proposal would only work if all players agree to it and stick to it. {'action': 'GO RIGHT',
 'reasoning': "Given the contract in place, it's risky to harvest the lone "
              'apple as it would result in a penalty. Therefore, I choose to '
              'move towards the right, closer to the apple, but not harvesting '
              'it yet. This allows me to be in a favorable position when more '
              'apples grow around the existing one, while also respecting the '
              'contract. I anticipate other players might also avoid '
              'harvesting the apple due to the contract, which could lead to a '
              'higher apple density in the next rounds.'}

This indicates that the upper part of the grid might not be as rich in apples as the right side.\n\nIn light of this, a better action for me would have been to move right instead of up. This would have likely resulted in a higher reward, given the success of Alice, Bob, and Eli.\n\nFor the next round, I should consider moving right to potentially collect more apples. However, I should also be aware that other players might have the same idea, which could lead to competition. To mitigate this, I could try to move right and then up or down to avoid direct competition.\n\nThe strategy of the other players seems to be to move towards areas where apples are growing faster, which is likely where there are more apples. I can use this information to predict their future moves and try to avoid direct competition. For example, if I notice a player consistently moving right and collecting a lot of apples, I might decide to move up or down after moving right to avoid them. \n\nIn conclusion, my strategy for the next round will be to move towards the right side of the grid, while also considering the movements of the other players to avoid direct competition.", additional_kwargs={}, example=False), HumanMessage(content='\nCurrently, you are at grid (4,1).  'reasoning': 'Given the current state of the world, the only apple is located '

Alice [SystemMessage(content="You are Alice. You are a player in a 2D grid-based world who can move around to collect apples. You want to collect as many apples as possible. {'action': 'GO RIGHT',
 'reasoning': "Given the contract in place, it's not beneficial to consume the "
              'apple in a low-density region. Therefore, I will move towards '
              'the right where the other players are, hoping that more apples '
              'will grow in that region due to the higher density. This also '
              'allows me to stay close to other players, which could be '
              'beneficial if future contracts involve sharing apples.'}

{'action': 'GO UP',
 'reasoning': 'Given the current state of the world, the only apple is located '
              'at grid (9,0), which is 2 grids up and 5 grids right from my '
              'current position. Since the contract discourages consumption in '
              'low-density regions, it would be beneficial to move towards the '
              'apple but not consume it immediately. Going up is the first '
              'step towards the apple, and it also potentially positions me '
              'closer to any new apples that might appear in the next round. '
              'Other players might also be moving towards the apple, but since '
              "we're all bound by the contract, it's unlikely anyone will "
              'consume the apple in the next round, maintaining a balance in '
              'the game.'}

{'action': 'GO UP',
 'reasoning': 'Given the contract in place and the current state of the game, '
              "it's likely that other players will also move towards the only "
              'apple at grid (9, 0). However, considering the contract, they '
              'might hesitate to consume the apple due to the punishment. By '
              "moving up, I'm getting closer to the apple and positioning "
              'myself to potentially consume it in the next round if the '
              'situation changes (e.g., more apples grow around it). This move '
              "also aligns with the contract's goal of preventing "
              'overconsumption in low-density regions.'}

 'reasoning': 'Given the current state of the game, no player collected any '

In the last round, you collected 0 apples, Alice collected 0 apples, Bob collected 0 apples, Cao collected 0 apples, Dhruv collected 0 apples, Eli collected 0 apples.\nCurrently, the world state is: (\'. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | Apple & Dhruv\\n. | . | . | . | Alice | Bob | Saida | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | Eli | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | Cao | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\\n. | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | . | .\',)\n\nYou can choose one of the following actions:\n- GO [UP/DOWN/LEFT/RIGHT]: you will move in the following direction for 1 grid.\n    "DIRECTION": [change in X, change in Y]:\n    "UP": [0, -1]\n    "DOWN": [0, 1]\n    "LEFT": [-1, 0]\n    "RIGHT": [1, 0]\n- STAY: soldier will not move and stay at the original location.\n- Collect: Collect the apple in the current grid.\n\nFor example:\n"GO down": you will move down the map for 1 grid.\n"STAY": you will just stay at the same location doing nothing.\n"COLLECT": you will collect 1 apple in the current grid.\n\nThink about how other players might take action and how that insinuates his/her strategy. {'action': 'GO RIGHT',
 'reasoning': 'Given the current state of the game, no player collected any '
              'apples in the last round, indicating a scarcity of apples. The '
              'nearest apple is at grid (9, 0), which can be reached by moving '
              'right 3 grids. Although there is a risk of competition with '
              'other players, moving right is the most direct route to the '
              'nearest apple. The fact that there is only one apple within a '
              'radius of 3 grids suggests that players may start moving '
              'towards this apple, so getting there first could be '
              'advantageous.'}

{'action': 'GO UP',
 'reasoning': "Given the contract in place, it's risky to consume the only "
              'apple in a low-density region. Therefore, I choose to move '
              'closer to the apple but not consume it this round. This allows '
              'me to be in a position to collect it in the next round if the '
              'contract is not renewed. Meanwhile, if another player consumes '
              'the apple, I will gain a portion of it due to the contract.'}

This suggests that there might have been a cluster of apples on the right side of the grid. \n\nHowever, it's also important to note that Saida, who also moved right, didn't collect any apples. This could mean that the right side of the grid is now depleted of apples, or Saida was too far from the cluster to collect any. \n\nIn terms of strategy, it seems that Alice and Eli are following a similar approach, possibly moving towards areas with higher apple density. Bob's strategy seems to be similar, but he might be further away from the apple clusters. Cao, like me, chose to go up and collected slightly more apples, suggesting that there might be some apples in that direction as well. Saida's strategy is unclear as she didn't collect any apples despite moving in the same direction as the highest collectors.\n\nFor the next round, I could consider moving right if I'm not too far from where Alice, Eli, and Bob are, as there might still be some apples left. However, if I'm closer to the top side of the grid, it might be more beneficial to continue moving up, following Cao's direction. \n\nTo improve my strategy, I need to consider the apple growth pattern. Since apples grow faster if more apples are close by, it might be beneficial to move towards areas where players have recently collected many apples, as new apples are likely to grow there. However, I should also avoid areas where no apples are left, as they won't grow back immediately. \n\nIn terms of using other players' actions to my advantage, I can observe their movements and rewards to infer the location of apple clusters. If a player consistently collects high rewards, it's likely that they are near a cluster. I can then move towards that direction in the next round. However, I should also be wary of depleting apple clusters, as indicated by a sudden drop in a player's reward despite them moving in the same direction.", additional_kwargs={}, example=False), HumanMessage(content='\nCurrently, you are at grid (9,0).
